oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Downtown Nashville skyline, facing northwest, circa 1950 August
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A skyline view of downtown Nashville, Tennessee, photographed from South Nashville looking northwest, circa August 1950. Several buildings and landmarks are visible in this photograph, such as the Tennessee State Capitol, Bennie Dillon Building (702 Church Street), Warner Building (later named the Sudekum Building, located at 535 Church Street), First Presbyterian Church (later named the Downtown Presbyterian Church, located at 154 Fifth Avenue North), Ryman Auditorium (116 Fifth Avenue North), Sanders Manufacturing Company (124 Fourth Avenue South), Beasley & Sons (147-151 Third Avenue North), and H. G. Lipscomb & Company (138-142 Second Avenue North). Lower right: the Shelby Street Bridge and the Tennessee Central Railway freight depot. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee State Capitol (Nashville, Tenn.); Bennie Dillon Building (Nashville, Tenn.); Warner Building (Nashville, Tenn.); Sudekum Building (Nashville, Tenn.); First Presbyterian Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Downtown Presbyterian Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Sanders Manufacturing Company (Nashville, Tenn.); H.
